title: How does LP really work
body:
So i have played a total of 6 Ranked games today with a avg LP of 19 for a win and 13 for a loss.
Now 6 x 19 is 114 - if i won them all, but i lost 2 so thats 26 for the losses so 88 LP give or take a few as some game i got a little more LP for wins But i only have 42 LP just trying to understand how it all works is all.

feel free to check profile just if i'm missing a detail i did not factor

replies.body:
It's because you stuffed up your maths:
Yes, 6 x 9 = 114, but you then stated that you lost 2 (then saying it made 88).

But what you did was subtract 2 losses from 6 wins (114 - 26 = 88), but that assumes 8 games played. For 6 games played, you won 4 (so 4 x 19 = 78) and lost 2 (2 x 13 = 26).

78 - 26 = 42.

I hope I explained this well enough?
yes yes it does, sometimes the lp system makes my brain melt,
